conclusion: Analyze the process of a gas moving from state A to state B in the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle.
The process from state A to state B is isothermal, meaning the temperature remains constant.
Identify the process from state A to state B as isothermal with constant temperature and gas expansion.
Under isothermal conditions, the gas expands from a smaller volume to a larger volume, typically resulting in an increase in internal energy.
Since the gas absorbs energy from the surroundings to expand, it will release heat to the surroundings as it does work.
In the Stirling cycle, the process from A to B is typically the expansion process where the gas absorbs heat.
Conclude that the gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B as it expands and gains energy.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
